intro: Ozothamnus adnatus, commonly known as the narrowleaf wattle, is a perennial shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and often nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features slender, often aromatic leaves and produces yellow flowers in late winter to early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to a variety of environmental conditions. Ozothamnus adnatus is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
